snippet: A lawsuit filed by the parents of a Harvard student who killed himself says that their son was misdiagnosed with A.D.H.D. and that the diagnostic procedure did not meet medical standards.
abstract: Lawsuit filed against Harvard by parents of Johnny Edwards, freshman who killed himself six months after being diagnosed by student-health clinic and prescribed antidepressants in single examination, is being seen as case study; parents say their son was misdiagnosed with ADHD and that diagnostic procedure did not meet medical standards.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed by the parents of a Harvard student who killed himself says that their son was misdiagnosed with A.D.H.D. and that the diagnostic procedure did not meet medical standards.

headline.seo: Harvard Suit Highlights A.D.H.D. Medication Problems
headline.main: Harvard Student’s Suicide as a Case Study
headline.print_headline: Harvard Student’s Suicide as a Case Study
